newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume drops sharply as prices rise.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume drops sharply as prices rise.

text.p: Istanbul gold exchange volume plunged to 585 kg on Thursday from Wednesday's 1,941 kg as higher prices lowered demand, dealers said.
Gold firmed to $361.90 an ounce and 1,405,500 lira per gramme from $357.00 and 1,395,100 lira on Wednesday in line with higher levels in Europe.
The Turkish currency eased to 122,090 lira to the dollar from 121,350 at Wednesday's close, which pushed up gold prices in lira.
The majority of the day's trade -- 315 kg -- was traded in the afternoon session and 79.5 percent of the total was conducted in dollar terms.
